info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 5:26PM EDT until March 18 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Pleasant River flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways and low lying properties along the Pleasant River due to elevated flows and backwater issues.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 PM EDT, emergency management and the public reported flooding near Pleasant Street and Pleasant River Road in Milo. - Pleasant Street and Pleasant River Road are closed due to flooding. Flooding expected downstream to the Piscataquis River. Water is expected to rise behind the jam upstream along the Pleasant River Road. Social media video of the ice jam shows erratic ice movement and increasing pressure behind the jam. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milo. - Ice jam located at the Pleasant Street bridge in Milo and continues to shift its placement. Minor flooding is occurring on Pleasant Street, Pleasant River Road and in the fields of Medford Road in Milo. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY
